meanings.definition: To cover (an area) with new sod.
meanings.sent1: The gardener resodded the bare patch in the lawn.
meanings.sent2: They resodded the entire backyard to make it look fresh.
meanings.sent3: After the heavy rain, the yard looked like it needed to be resodded.
meanings.sent4: The resodded lawn was as green as an emerald.
meanings.sent5: The resodded area transformed the yard into a lush paradise.

meanings.sent1: We resodded the front yard to improve its appearance.
meanings.sent2: The soccer field was resodded before the big game.
meanings.sent3: The resodded garden made the neighbors jealous.
meanings.sent4: She resodded her heart after the breakup.
meanings.sent5: The resodded area felt like walking on a soft carpet.
